author: Admin
title: LIVE: Bizarre claim after Pakistan's slips nightmare - Top World News Today
text: Pakistan could well be in a position to win this match already if not for some poor fielding. Abdullah Shafique has grassed both David Warner and Mitchell Marsh early in their innings. Former Aussie captain Mark Taylor may have the answer to why they struggle in the field. â€œThereâ€™s no doubt theyâ€™re moreâ€¦ individually focused on things like runs and wickets,â€ Taylor told Wide World of Sports. â€œYou look at say India and Pakistan, you go back 20 years ago, they were both a bit the same â€“ they didnâ€™t take enough opportunities. But India have just, in the last 15 or 20 years, have just put that to bed. â€œWhen you donâ€™t hang on to your catches, it gonna cost you, it can cost you matches. â€œShafique has dropped three catches in this match and everyone drops catches, but you can see that theyâ€™ve cost them Iâ€™d say hundreds of runs. â€œAnd in Australia mate slips catching is gold.â€ Australia vs Pakistan 2nd Test Day 4 Live: Australia aim to maintain dominanceÂ© AFPAustralia vs Pakistan 2nd Test Day 4 Live Updates: Resuming at 187/6 on Frid The Indian team laid out an uninspiring performance in Centurion, suffering a devastating defeat by an innings and 32 runs against a markedly superior South A Stalwart batter Virat Kohli became the first batter to score 2000 runs in seven different calendar years during India's crushing defeat to South Africa in the 1 MELBOURNE (Reuters) - Pakistan were set an imposing victory target of 317

author: @wion
title: US on path to see 'historic' drop in yearly homicide numbers: Report - World News
text: US on path to see 'historic' drop in yearly homicide numbers: Report Story highlights The drop in homicides and other violent crimes in the year 2023 is being attributed to better efforts towards crime prevention which included work with community volunteers. US media says that there were also attempts to target gun possession in high-crime areas. The law enforcement has also strengthened patrols The drop in homicides and other violent crimes in the year 2023 is being attributed to better efforts towards crime prevention which included work with community volunteers. US media says that there were also attempts to target gun possession in high-crime areas. The law enforcement has also strengthened patrols The United States is set to finish the year 2023 with a 'historic' decrease in annual homicide cases on record, said multiple news reports in the US media citing preliminary data collected by law enforcement agencies in the country. ABC News quoted Jeff Asher, a crime analyst, who said that nearly 13 per cent drop in homicide rate is expected by the end of year 2023 than the year 2022. However, the decreased homicide rate does not mean that Americans feel more secure. A Gallup poll which was released last month, revealed that more than three-quarters of the respondents felt that crime has increased in the country and more than half fell the same about crime in their area. trending now Watch | Japan to send patriot missiles to the United States The drop in homicides and other violent crimes in the year 2023 is being attributed to better efforts towards crime prevention which included work with community volunteers. US media says that there were also attempts to target gun possession in high-crime areas. The law enforcement has also strengthened patrols. "It is historic. It's the largest one-year decline," said Asher, as quoted by ABC News. "It's cities of every size, it's the suburbs, it's rural counties, tiny cities, it's large cities. It's really a national decline." Also Read | [Tesla recalls 120,000 cars in United States over risk of doors getting unlocked during crash](https://www.wionews.com/world/tesla-recalls-120000-cars-which-can-unlock-in-crash-in-united-states-672974) Asher is co-founder of AH Datalytics. In past, he also worked as crime analyst for the CIA and police in New Orleans. He told the news outlet that his analysis was based on preliminary crime data from 180 law enforcement agencies. In its report, ABC News cited data obtained from its own review and said that as they headed into last week of the year, 10 largest cities in the US showed seven municipalities with double-digit year-over-year declines in homicides this yea. In New York City, the drop was 11 per cent. In Los Angeles, it was 16 per cent while it was 13 per cent in Chicago. (With inputs from agencies)

author: Mario Bartel
title: Residents of Port Moody, Coquitlam are struggling with high rents - Tri-City News
text: The MP for Port Moodyâ€”Coquitlam says the federal government isnâ€™t doing enough to deliver affordable housing. Standing outside a vacant former Canada Post building at 45 Mary St. in Port Moody on Wednesday, Aug. 14, Bonita Zarrillo said many residents in her riding are struggling with high rents and housing instability while public properties that could be used for affordable housing sit fallow. â€œPeople canâ€™t find an affordable, stable place to rent,â€ the NDP MP said. â€œImagine paying 100 per cent of your income to keep a roof over your head and even then, thereâ€™s a risk of demovictions from corporations.â€ The Canada Post building in Port Moody is one of six identified last April by Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Finance Chrystia Freeland in her federal budget as potential locations for new homes through a new Canada Post Housing Program. She said the program would â€œsupport affordable housing providers to build on disposed or leased Canada Post properties,â€ adding details would be forthcoming â€œlater this year.â€ But so far, Zarrillo said, nothing has been announced. â€œFor years there has been an opportunity to turn this public land into affordable housing,â€ she said. â€œBut the Liberals have done nothing about it.â€ According to a report by liv.rent, a rental platform and resource centre for tenants and landlords, the average rent for a one-bedroom unfurnished apartment in Coquitlam in July was $2,052, while a two-bedroom was going for $2,718 and three-bedroom apartments cost $3,600. As well, tenants in Metro Vancouver spend about 43 per cent of their income on rent, said the report. ðŸ“£ Got an opinion on this story or any others in the Tri-Cities? Send us a letter or email your thoughts or story tips to [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#56383321252439393b1622243f353f222f383321257835393b). ðŸ“² Want to stay updated on Coquitlam, Port Coquitlam, Port Moody, Anmore and Belcarra news? Sign up for our free daily newsletter . ðŸ’¬ Words missing in an article? Your adblocker might be preventing hyperlinked text from appearing.

author: Nieves Salinas
title: MÃ¡s zonas verdes, acceso a instalaciones deportivas, control del ruido... asÃ­ pueden los ayuntamientos mejorar nuestra salud
text:
ENFERMEDADES NO TRANSMISIBLES
MÃ¡s zonas verdes, acceso a instalaciones deportivas, control del ruido... asÃ­ pueden los ayuntamientos mejorar nuestra salud
Un informe pone el foco en el papel de los consistorios en la promociÃ³n de hÃ¡bitos saludables para prevenir enfermedades no transmisibles y promover la salud pÃºblica
Nieves Salinas
Salvo en grandes ciudades, como
Madrid, Barcelona, Valencia o Sevilla, la actividad municipal en [salud](/tags/salud/) pÃºblica se restringe a aspectos como la higiene y la salubridad. Sin embargo, su papel puede ir mÃ¡s allÃ¡, en la prevenciÃ³n de enfermedades no transmisibles, como las cardiovasculares, renales o metabÃ³licas, en salud mental o en las relacionadas con la obesidad. Lo asegura a El PeriÃ³dico de EspaÃ±a, de Prensa IbÃ©rica, la doctora Dolores Rubio y Lleonart, ex directora general de Salud PÃºblica del Gobierno de La Rioja y de la Junta de Comunidades de Castilla-La Mancha. La experta cita iniciativas como impulsar mÃ¡s zonas verdes para que los mayores hagan ejercicio o precios asequibles a las instalaciones deportivas.
La doctora Rubio y Lleonart es especialista en
[Medicina](/tags/medicina/) de la Actividad FÃ­sica y el Deporte y miembro del Observatorio EconomÃ­a y Salud. AdemÃ¡s, es una de las autoras del informe 'DesafÃ­os emergentes para la salud pÃºblica: las enfermedades no transmisibles', que ha elaborado esta entidad, con la colaboraciÃ³n de la compaÃ±Ã­a Boehringer Ingelheim EspaÃ±a.
Un documento en el que se pone el acento en como, ante la elevada prevalencia de ese tipo de dolencias, es necesaria "una mayor adaptaciÃ³n y coordinaciÃ³n de las polÃ­ticas sanitarias a todos los niveles". Los expertos se remiten a patologÃ­as responsables del 74% de los fallecimientos a nivel mundial, segÃºn la OrganizaciÃ³n Mundial de la Salud (
[OMS](/tags/oms/)).
El envejecimiento
En las Ãºltimas dÃ©cadas, seÃ±alan, han surgido "importantes desafÃ­os" que han modificado los paradigmas existentes en salud pÃºblica, como la globalizaciÃ³n, el envejecimiento progresivo de la poblaciÃ³n, los retos medioambientales, las grandes diferencias socioeconÃ³micas entre territorios o los hÃ¡bitos de vida sedentarios.
Los expertos abogan por impulsar una "mayor adaptaciÃ³n y coordinaciÃ³n" de las polÃ­ticas sanitarias a todos los niveles, tambiÃ©n al municipal
Es en ese contexto, enfatizan, donde se debe impulsar una "mayor adaptaciÃ³n y coordinaciÃ³n" de las polÃ­ticas sanitarias a todos los niveles. TambiÃ©n al municipal. "Los ayuntamientos son un ente administrativo clave en la implementaciÃ³n de polÃ­ticas de prevenciÃ³n, de cara a lograr una salud pÃºblica que sea mÃ¡s sÃ³lida, cohesionada, predictiva y capaz de un cambio de modelo", seÃ±ala la doctora Rubio.
"Si estudiamos las poblaciones, en el momento actual, vivimos mÃ¡s aÃ±os que nunca", aÃ±ade y, aunque a partir de los 65 aÃ±os hay una mayor relaciÃ³n con procesos de discapacidad y fragilidad, de lo que se trata es de "retrasar estos efectos". El reto "es extender la calidad de vida".
Un papel clave
Es ahÃ­ donde, dice esta experta, los ayuntamientos pueden jugar un papel clave poniendo en marcha medidas como, por ejemplo, fomentar la venta de productos de cercanÃ­a para promover una buena
[alimentaciÃ³n ](/tags/alimentacion/)y la adquisiciÃ³n de hÃ¡bitos saludables. O extender las zonas verdes adaptadas ergonÃ³micamente para que las personas mayores puedan desarrollar actividad fÃ­sica y permitir un acceso asequible a las infraestructuras deportivas municipales.
Aumentar el nÃºmero de fuentes de agua potable en las calles, controlar
el ruido en las ciudades, adquirir mobiliario urbano y de movilidad (transporte) mÃ¡s eficiente o poner en marcha medidas de prevenciÃ³n en el Ã¡mbito laboral ayudarÃ­a, dice la mÃ©dico, a un menor impacto de esas patologÃ­as que suponen la primera causa de muerte en el mundo: el cÃ¡ncer, las enfermedades cardiovasculares, la diabetes, la obesidad o los trastornos de salud mental.
Salud pulmonar
"La municipalidad juega un papel importante. Por ejemplo, el concepto de 'salud pulmonar', ligado a los espacios verdes, va cogiendo fuerza", reseÃ±a la experta. Un nuevo y recientÃ­simo estudio -realizado con 35.000 niÃ±os y niÃ±as de ocho paÃ­ses y publicado en Environment International, que lidera el Instituto de Salud Global de Barcelona (ISGlobal)-, ha hallado un vÃ­nculo 'sÃ³lido' entre la exposiciÃ³n a espacios verdes en la primera infancia y una mejor funciÃ³n pulmonar.
Si se trata de seÃ±alar municipios desde los que se promueve la salud pÃºblica, la experta pone dos ejemplos. Por un lado, el Ayuntamiento de Madrid, que ha puesto en marcha un mapa que busca identificar los activos de salud de cada barrio, para delimitar espacios que influyen positivamente en la vida cotidiana de los ciudadanos. Por otro, tambiÃ©n cita una iniciativa puesta en marcha en la ciudad de Jerez (CÃ¡diz), donde se ha creado la figura del 'agente de salud' para el fomento de estilos de vida saludables y el autocuidado.
En el informe del Observatorio EconomÃ­a y Salud, sus autores desglosan un decÃ¡logo de propuestas encaminadas a mejorar ese abordaje de las enfermedades no transmisibles. Entre otras, potenciar el cribado y diagnÃ³stico; realizar modificaciones legislativas para contar con instrumentos de control, gestiÃ³n y de aportaciÃ³n de datos como la Agencia Estatal de Salud PÃºblica o desarrollar mÃ¡s leyes de salud pÃºblica de Ã¡mbito autonÃ³mico que impulsen la gestiÃ³n de polÃ­ticas especÃ­ficas para estos territorios, prestando especial atenciÃ³n a la importancia de los municipios.
Salud advierte sobre el Â«peligroÂ» del acto conducido por Miguel BosÃ© y Josep PÃ mies en Mallorca La familia okupa que secuestrÃ³ al dueÃ±o de una empresa de desokupaciÃ³n en Cala Rajada pedÃ­a dinero para irse de las viviendas Muere una bebÃ© de dos meses por un desprendimiento de rocas en una playa de Formentera El conseller insular de Turismo en Mallorca fulmina a su nÃºmero dos Estos son los nuevos horarios del carril Bus-VAO de Palma El Ayuntamiento compra la finca de Son Quint para abrirla a los ciudadanos y empezar a perfilar el bosque metropolitano Marta Vidal: La primera â€˜consellera estrellaâ€™ en estrellarse AdiÃ³s a las cucarachas este verano: la planta que las ahuyentarÃ¡ para siempre

author: FotMob
title: Cristiano Ronaldo scores 900th goal: The stats behind Portugal great's latest landmark
text: Cristiano Ronaldo has now scored 900 career goals. We dive into the Opta data to analyse how he reached that eye-watering figure. Another match, another landmark for Cristiano Ronaldo. The five-time Ballon d'Or winner insisted he still has more to offer at the international level this week, and he brought up 900 career goals by netting in Portugal's Nations League Nations League opener versus Croatia. It was a typical poacher's finish that brought up Ronaldo's latest landmark, the forward beating his marker to Nuno Mendes' left-wing cross to sidefoot home and put Portugal 2-0 up inside the first half. Never one to rest on his laurels, Ronaldo will now surely be targeting the big 1,000, though Pele's FIFA-recognised figure of 1,281 goals will surely prove beyond the 39-year-old. As Ronaldo plots a route to four figures, we dive into the Opta data to look at how he reached his current total, highlighting the most interesting facts and figures. Ronaldo's 900th career goal was also his 131st in 213 appearances for Portugal, with both of those figures being all-time records both for the Selecao and for any male player on the international stage. The ultimate goal poacher, he has scored 109 of those from inside the penalty area, though only 20 have come from the penalty spot â€“ he memorably missed his last spot-kick for the Selecao, versus Slovenia in the Euro 2024 quarter-finals. Ronaldo struggled at this year's tournament in Germany, where he had 23 shots but failed to find the net â€“ the first time he has not scored at a major international competition. Only fellow Portugal great Deco has ever had more efforts at a single edition of the Euros without scoring, firing off 24 shots without success at the 2004 tournament. However, Ronaldo does boast 22 goals at the World Cup/Euros for Portugal overall, winning the Golden Boot with five strikes at Euro 2020, five years on from captaining the Selecao to their maiden trophy. Only two of those, though, have come in knockout matches â€“ versus the Netherlands at Euro 2004 and Wales at Euro 2016. Still, Ronaldo's international legacy speaks for itself, and his achievements on the club stage are even more impressive. Ronaldo scored five times for boyhood club Sporting CP before leaving for Manchester United, for whom he plundered 145 goals across two separate spells. He has broken three figures with all but two of his clubs, netting 101 times for Juventus and being well on the way to doing so with Al-Nassr, for whom he has 68 goals. It was at Real Madrid, however, where Ronaldo earned his goal machine tag, scoring exactly half his career goals (450) for Los Blancos and helping them win the Champions League four times. He is the leading goalscorer in Madrid's illustrious history, some 96 clear of former team-mate Karim Benzema (354), who represented the club 648 times, compared to Ronaldo's 438 appearances. Overall, Ronaldo has scored 573 of his goals with his favoured right foot, with 173 coming via his left and almost as many â€“ 152 â€“ coming via headers, with his aerial prowess becoming increasingly notable throughout his career. What about dead balls? Ronaldo has converted 164 penalties for club and country, including a spot-kick in the 2014 Champions League final versus Atletico Madrid. Ronaldo's free-kick taking has been an area targeted by those looking to do down on his achievements at times, but he has scored 64 direct free-kick goals throughout his career, the latest coming in a 4-1 win over Al-Fayha in the Saudi Pro League before the turn of the month. Where, then, do Ronaldo's achievements rank versus those of his peers? Drum roll please... Ronaldo is currently some 62 goals ahead of his great rival Lionel Messi, who has 838 career strikes for Barcelona, Paris Saint-Germain, Inter Miami and Argentina. With Ronaldo firing on all cylinders in Saudi Arabia and looking unlikely to give up the ghost at international level any time soon, few would bet against him extending that advantage before the two greats hang up their boots.

author: Sean Moran
title: Migration Activists Sue to Block Trump from Deporting Alleged Illegal Alien Gangs
text:
Immigration activists have sued to block President Donald Trump from deporting alleged Venezuelan gang members using a wartime authority.
The Trump administration has invoked the Alien Enemies Act of 1798 to deport illegal aliens, especially those with alleged gang affiliations such as Tren de Aragua or MS-13.
The Supreme Court ruled that the Trump administration could continue to use the centuries-old authority to deport illegal Venezuelan immigrants alleged to be gang members; however, justices said that the migrants must be given time to challenge their deportation under the Alien Enemies Act.
A Trump Justice Department spokesperson said that the department has â€œvigorously defended President Trumpâ€™s policies and will continue to do so whenever challenged in federal court by rogue judges who think they can control the Presidentâ€™s foreign policy and national security agenda. The Supreme Courtâ€™s recent decisions have validated the DOJâ€™s ongoing arguments to this end in court.â€
Lee Gelernt, a lawyer at the American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU), said, â€œContrary to the administrationâ€™s wishful characterization, the Supreme Court emphatically rejected the governmentâ€™s position that they could whisk people away without giving them an opportunity to challenge their removal to a foreign prison.â€
â€œThe Court simply issued a technical ruling that the challenges should be by habeas corpus, but in no way remotely suggested the Trump administration would win these challenges,â€ Gelernt added.
Subsequently, the ACLU and other pro-migrant groups have filed to have the government barred from using the Alien Enemies Act altogether:
If that fails, the ACLU and others noted that the Supreme Court requires that the government first inform detainees that they were designated â€œenemiesâ€ under the act and then give them the chance to challenge that classification in court. The Supreme Court did not weigh in on the legality of Trumpâ€™s proclamation. That means the government could have to explain to a judge â€” and potentially the public â€” its justification for describing immigrants as gang members eligible for removal under the act. The government has so far refused to release their names or details about their alleged gang affiliation or criminal histories, though it alleges that several of those removed were responsible for heinous crimes. One expert at the Migration Policy Institute said that the ruling from the nationâ€™s highest court grants these migrants due process. â€œICEâ€™s position so far has been, â€˜We decide that these people are aliens, and we can just remove them. We get to decide who is an enemy and who is not,â€™ and that, I think, has been set aside by the Supreme Court. Thatâ€™s the good part. The bad part is that, to use the due process that the Supreme Court said theyâ€™re entitled to, is now a much more tedious and difficult hurdle to cross,â€ Muzaffar Chishti, a senior fellow at the institute, said.
Sean Moran is a policy reporter for Breitbart News. Follow him on X @SeanMoran3 .
topics: Crime, Law and Justice->human smuggling and trafficking
